intro: Valantia aparine, commonly known as stickseed, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and hairy stems. The plant produces small, dry fruits called schizocarps, which split into two one-seeded parts when mature. Valantia aparine typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is often found in grassland habitats. Its distinctive appearance and adaptive features make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
